meanings.definition: A layer of material laid on the ground to support a road or building.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers poured the subbase before laying the asphalt for the road.
meanings.sent2: The subbase provides a stable foundation for the new building.
meanings.sent3: The subbase decided it was time to take a break from supporting all the weight.
meanings.sent4: The subbase of the project was the teamwork and dedication of the entire crew.
meanings.sent5: The subbase, like a sturdy rock, held everything together with unwavering strength.
